Key Match Events: India vs Sri Lanka, 1st ODI ended in a tie with India all out while chasing 231 runs.
Rohit Sharma scored 58 off 47 balls for India.
Axar Patel and KL Rahul contributed 33 and 31 runs respectively for India.
Wanindu Hasaranga and Charith Asalanka took three wickets each for Sri Lanka.
Dunith Wellalage scored an unbeaten 67 off 65 balls for Sri Lanka.
Prathum Nissanka scored 56 off 75 balls for Sri Lanka.
Arshdeep Singh and Axar Patel took two wickets each for India.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka skipper Charith Asalanka won the toss and opted to bat first at the R Premadasa stadium in Colombo.
Indian skipper Rohit Sharma mentioned that it looked like a good surface and he was fine with batting second.
India had dominated the T20I leg of the series, winning all 3 matches.
Gautam Gambhir commented on Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's future, stating they still have a lot of cricket left in them.
Sanath Jayasuriya, interim coach of Sri Lanka, emphasized the importance of creating a good environment for players.
Rohit Sharma expressed excitement about the new phase with a new coach and the team's energy.
Premadasa stadium pitch report indicated advantages for spinners and effectiveness for pacers early in the innings.
India and Sri Lanka have played 168 ODI matches against each other, with India winning 99 and Sri Lanka winning 57.
There was a high chance of rain affecting the 1st ODI match in Colombo.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The second ODI will take place on Sunday at the same stadium in Colombo.
